NASDAQ 3.125% Notes due 2028 &#160;&#160; MSFT &#160;&#160; NASDAQ 2.625% Notes due 2033 &#160;&#160; MSFT &#160;&#160; NASDAQ Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule 12b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter). Emerging growth company&#160; &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has Re-elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;5.07. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders On December&#160;13, 2022, Microsoft Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) held its 2022 Annual Shareholders Meeting (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;). There were 7,456,502,484 shares of common stock entitled to be voted at the Annual Meeting, of which 6,407,164,715 were voted in person or by proxy. The results for each item submitted for a vote of shareholders are as follows. The shareholders: (1) Voted to elect each of the twelve (12)&#160;nominees for director. (2) Approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Company&#8217;s named executive officers. (3) Voted to ratify the appointment of Deloitte&#160;&amp; Touche LLP as the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2023. (4) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a cost/benefit analysis of diversity and inclusion. (5) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on hiring of persons with arrest or incarceration records. (6) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on investment of retirement funds in companies contributing to climate change (7) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on &#160; government use of Microsoft technology. (8) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on development of products for the military. (9) Did not approve a shareholder proposal concerning a report on tax transparency. The Company&#8217;s inspector of election certified the following vote tabulations: Election of Directors &#160; Director &#160;&#160; Vote&#160;Results &#160; &#160;&#160; %&#160;Votes For &#160; &#160; For &#160; &#160;&#160; Against &#160; &#160;&#160; Abstain &#160; &#160;&#160; Broker Non-Votes &#160; Reid G.
